concept.title: Creating Expand/Collapse Sections
concept.shortdesc: Expand/collapse sections are links in your generated output that users can click on to expand and collapse content.

conbody.p:
expand/collapse sections
creating
Creating expand/collapse sections are accomplished by setting the boundaries of an expansion section through ePublisher paragraph styles. In DITA ePublisher paragraph styles are applied through the outputclass attribute. For example, if you wanted to apply the ePublisher paragraph style body to a paragraph in a DITA topic, you would mark the paragraph like this:

In this example, the procedure list below has the ExpandCollapse output class applied to the <Title> element. Because the Stationery Designer defined the output class ExpandCollapse with the Expand/Collapse feature, the procedure introductory statement displays a trigger next to it, and when users click the trigger, the steps in the procedure will display.
In DITA, everything contained in the file will be included in the Expand/Collapse field. As a result, when creating an Expand/Collapse section, all the information should be written in a single Task.
